intro: Phyllanthus retusus, commonly known as the Indian cheesewood, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers, followed by capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Euphorbiaceae family.
